benchmark_details.name: MOCHA (Multi-turn Robust Code Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: MOCHA is a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating the robustness of code LLMs against multi-turn malicious coding prompts, focusing on vulnerabilities of models when faced with sophisticated adversarial attacks that decompose malicious tasks into seemingly benign subtasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic evaluation benchmark for the robustness of code language models against adversarial and malicious prompts, particularly focusing on multi-turn interactions.

data.source: Generated through a combination of language models and synthesized prompt engineering techniques.
data.size: 10,084 training samples, 200 validation prompts, 200 test samples
data.annotation: Manually verified for malicious intent and categorized based on threat types.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of models against adversarial prompts during evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher rejection rates indicate better robustness to malicious prompts.
methodology.validation: Dataset validated through manual review of sample prompts.
